Five parties issue joint statement after US president warns he would occupy island â€˜the nice way or the more difficult wayâ€™ Greenlanders â€œdonâ€™t want to be Americansâ€ and must decide the future of the Arctic island themselves, politicians in the self-governing Danish territory have said, after Donald Trump warned the US would â€œdo something whether they like it or notâ€. The leaders of five political parties in the Greenlandic parliament issued a united statement on Friday night, soon after the US president reiterated his threats to acquire the mineral-rich island.
